summary.title: Freelance software engineer, lead front-end developer
summary.about:
Advocate of automating all that can be done, especially tests at every level.
Strong interest in sharing knowledge and experience.
Speaker and organizer of software crafting and React events.

accomplishments.description:
[Caiman] As part of a team of 5 to 7 people, development of a web application to create software configurations for vehicles, whose aim is to collect on-board data.

I acted as a front-end technical advisor, sharing my knowledge and experience through one-on-one mentoring and formal presentations to help less experienced colleagues develop their skills.

English-speaking environment required due to the presence of Indian colleagues.
[Banjo] I developed an application which helps monitoring map requests sent by Bosch in order to update their cartography solution.

In complete technical autonomy, I wrote the mobile app 'Cofidoc Taxi', allowing to save taxi courses for patients transport, and generate PDF certificates of transport.
Ergonomic proposals, development, release on the Android and iOS stores, maintenance and support were my daily routine.

[SAM] In a 4-developer team, I contribute to the development of a web application for access rights automation.
As a lead developer, I help sharing knowledge and experience between team members, and introduces test driven development (TDD) end end-to-end testing in common practices.

In a 6-person full remote team, starting from an application prototype for optimizing aircraft filling, I contribute to the rewriting of the user interface.
I bring support to the junior developer, and am in charge of end-to-end test automation.

I contributed to the implementation of BSS v3 UI, the next generation app for Sigfox customers price grids, quotes, contracts and orders.
I also presented Cypress, an end-to-end tests framework, which the team adopted. Then my mission turned out into support with using Cypress and defining test strategies for the current project.

Working for ISIS, a widely-customizable standalone application for monitoring satellite missions, I implement UI features.
I also led the team on the use of React and Redux, and on test writing.
As a member of a 10-person agile team, I contributed to the development of API and UI micro-services for Cegedim's next health insurance solution.
I implemented a cross-platform mobile app for optic patients, including deployment to Android Play Store, the associated web portal for opticians and the corresponding back-end

As a consultant on behalf of Celad, I developed a connector between PayZen (Lyra's online payment solution) and south-american payment methods:
- analysis of south-american payment methods API
- connector implementation
- integration to PayZen
As a consultant on behalf of Celad, I was in charge of technical coaching and development in a 5-member team, creating web applications for the Credit department (CCO).

I supervised students on their final-year project of engineering school.
By pair, students developed an autonomous application of a hospital information system (admission, radiology, pharmacy, invoicing...).

Students objectives : 
- learn and apply Java development principles and service-oriented architecture, 
- learn and apply quality standards in coding as Test Driven Development and JUnit, 
- applying lessons concerning the architecture of health information systems.

jobs.title: JEE software engineer, then project manager

accomplishments.description: Assigned to PGIH department (PGIH is an ERP for french hospitals), I was in charge of developing and managing 300 to 3000 man-days projects, 3 to 5 persons.

Assigned to PGIH department (PGIH is an ERP for french hospitals), I managed ESPIC project: a top-priority project of 15 man-years over 18 months, consisting in evolving PGIH to adapt it to private health establishments workflow.
On behalf of Artware, I was in charge of new web application development in 3-to-6-member teams.

formations.title: Engineer degree in computer science
formations.organizer: Ecole Supérieure d'Electronique de l'Ouest - ESEO, Angers, France

talks.title: What if we tested our front-end?
